About Archives

An archive is a Version Manager file that stores the evolutionary history of a versioned file. The history of a versioned file includes descriptions of changes, who made the changes, and when they were made. Archives also contain version label and promotion group information.

Version Manager can reconstruct any revision of a versioned file by using the information in the file's archive. By default, Version Manager stores only the latest revisions of non-binary files as complete copies of the workfiles and all other revisions as sets of deltas, or changes. This method conserves disk space by not saving a complete copy of the workfile each time you create a revision.
